author: Gennaro Contaldo
method: Wash and scrub the beetroot under cold running water. Place them in a saucepan with the vinegar, salt and water and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat, cover then pan and simmer for about 1¼ hours until the beetroot is tender. Meanwhile, combine all the marinade ingredients in a bowl and set aside. Once the beetroot is cooked, drain, place on a cloth and pat dry. Remove the skins with the help of the cloth. Cut into slices, place in the marinade and mix well. Leave for a day before serving. The beetroot will keep for several days in a covered container in the fridge but should be brought to room temperature before serving. Serve with some salami or air dried tuna.
ingredients: 650g/1lb 7oz raw beetroot,  500ml/17fl oz white or red wine vinegar,  2 litre/3½ pints water,  pinch of salt,  2 garlic cloves, sliced,  1 tbsp dried oregano,  1 red chilli, finely chopped,  500ml/17fl oz olive oil
